text: the man here in the white t-shirt and
Jean shorts is Carlos Mercado it's late
August 2013 in Brooklyn New York and
plainclothes officers are arresting him
for selling two packets of heroin 15
hours after entering the Rikers Island
jail complex he'll be dead he was 45
years old
mr. Mikado's death shows the legacy of
poor prisoner treatment at Rikers which
now haunts officials as they try to make
changes around 7:00 p.m. surveillance
video shows mr. Mercado walking into his
holding cell with a large plastic bag
the surveillance video doesn't record
sound nearly four hours later a guard
opens the cell door mr. Mercado
collapses he lies there for three
minutes at 11:16 the inmates line up for
dinner but mr. Mercado is not there
according to a state report inmate
witnesses later said that all through
the night mr. Mercado had asked guards
for medical help
mr. Mikado vomits repeatedly throughout
the night at times carrying his vomit
around with them in plastic bags here
he appears unsteady on his feet early
the next morning is the last time mr.
Mikado appears on camera at 8:25 a.m.
according to investigators a corrections
officer requests medical help for mr.
Mikado but a nurse indicates that he
doesn't need immediate attention
[Music]
the autopsy report determined that mr.
Mercado died of complications from
diabetes
